summary: This is a compilation of news clips from March 9, 2020, covering multiple cases handled by the Southern District of New York (SDNY). The primary focus is on the Epstein investigation, specifically Prince Andrew's refusal to cooperate, and updates on the Metropolitan Correctional Center after Epstein's death. It also covers unrelated cases including a major horse racing doping scandal, the trial of CIA leaker Joshua Schulte, the arrest of Lawrence Ray for alleged sex trafficking, and political commentary on SDNY's independence and Attorney General William Barr.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.role: British royal, friend of Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Reportedly declined to cooperate with the U.S. investigation into Epstein's co-conspirators, despite a public offer to help. Has denied allegations of sexual misconduct.

persons.name: Geoffrey Berman
persons.role: U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Announced Prince Andrew's non-cooperation, oversaw the horse racing doping indictments, and commented on the independence of the SDNY from political influence.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Deceased financier and accused sex trafficker
persons.context: The central figure in the investigation. Died by suicide in the Metropolitan Correctional Center in August 2019 while awaiting trial on sex trafficking charges.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.role: British socialite, longtime associate of Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Identified as a focus of the FBI probe into individuals who facilitated Epstein's alleged trafficking of underage girls.

persons.name: Jermaine Darden
persons.context: Was the captain in charge when Epstein died. Was scheduled to be transferred to a new position at FCI Fort Dix.

persons.name: Tova Noel
persons.context: Accused of sleeping on the job and falsifying records the night of Epstein's death. Pleaded not guilty.

persons.name: Michael Thomas
persons.context: Accused of sleeping on the job and falsifying records the night of Epstein's death. Pleaded not guilty.

persons.name: Montell Figgins
persons.role: Defense Attorney for Officer Michael Thomas
persons.context: Criticized the Bureau of Prisons for transferring Captain Darden instead of holding leadership accountable for failures leading to Epstein's death.

persons.name: Lamine N'Diaye
persons.context: Was warden during Epstein's death. Was moved to a desk job in Pennsylvania, with a planned transfer to Fort Dix put on hold by Attorney General Barr.

persons.name: William Barr
persons.context: Ordered a hold on Warden N'Diaye's transfer. Was criticized in a judicial opinion and news analysis for lacking credibility and political independence.

persons.name: Jorge Navarro
persons.context: Indicted for orchestrating an international horse doping scheme. Allegedly administered PEDs to horses, including one that later died.

persons.name: Jason Servis
persons.context: Indicted in the doping scheme. Trainer of Maximum Security. Allegedly discussed PEDs with co-conspirators.

persons.name: William F. Sweeney Jr.
persons.role: FBI Assistant Director in Charge, New York Office
persons.context: Commented on the cruelty and dangers of the horse doping scheme during the press conference announcing indictments.

persons.name: Kristian Rhein
persons.context: Co-defendant in the doping scheme. Allegedly assured Jason Servis that a PED given to Maximum Security wouldn't show up on tests.

persons.name: Louis Grasso
persons.context: Indicted in the doping scheme. Allegedly distributed 'cobra venom' as a painkiller and submitted false prescriptions.

persons.name: Joshua Schulte
persons.context: Trial ended in a hung jury on charges of leaking CIA documents to WikiLeaks. Was convicted on contempt and false statement charges.

persons.name: Sabrina Shroff
persons.context: Represented Schulte at trial, arguing the CIA's security was weak and that prosecutors withheld information about a witness.

persons.name: Lawrence Ray
persons.context: Arrested and charged with sex trafficking, forced labor, and extortion, allegedly involving victims from Sarah Lawrence College.

persons.name: Danielle Sassoon
persons.context: Described financial ledgers allegedly showing large earnings from prostitution by a victim in the Lawrence Ray case.

persons.name: Harvey Weinstein
persons.context: Reportedly injured in Rikers Island jail, experiencing dizziness and possible concussion. Awaiting sentencing.

persons.name: Juda Englemayer
persons.context: Spoke to media about Weinstein's fall and health condition in jail.

persons.name: Reggie Walton
persons.context: Issued a scathing opinion questioning Attorney General William Barr's credibility and political independence regarding the Mueller report.

persons.name: James Margolin
persons.role: Spokesman for U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman
persons.context: Declined to comment on options being considered regarding Prince Andrew's non-cooperation.

persons.name: Clare Montgomery
persons.context: Reportedly represents Prince Andrew on matters related to Epstein. Declined to comment.

connections.description: Described as a friend. Prince Andrew socialized with Epstein and has called the association 'ill-judged'.
Maxwell is identified as a longtime associate of Epstein's and a focus of the FBI probe into facilitators of his alleged trafficking.
Darden, as captain of the MCC, oversaw officers including Noel, who were under his command.
Darden, as captain of the MCC, oversaw officers including Thomas, who were under his command.
Figgins is identified as the defense attorney for correctional officer Michael Thomas.
Both were indicted in the same horse racing doping conspiracy. Discussed PEDs in an intercepted phone call.
Veterinarian Rhein allegedly assured trainer Servis about undetectable PEDs for his horse.
Tension exists between the SDNY U.S. Attorney and the Attorney General over case management and political independence.
Sassoon is the AUSA prosecuting Ray, having described evidence against him at his arraignment.

events.title: Prince Andrew Declines Cooperation
events.description: U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman announces that Britain's Prince Andrew has 'completely shut the door' on voluntarily cooperating with the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's co-conspirators.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein's Death
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found hanging in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center at 6:30 a.m.

events.title: Horse Racing Doping Indictments
events.description: SDNY announces indictments against 27 individuals, including trainers and veterinarians, in an international racehorse doping scheme described as the largest such prosecution in DOJ history.

events.title: Joshua Schulte Trial Ends in Hung Jury
events.description: The trial of former CIA programmer Joshua Schulte, accused of leaking classified documents to WikiLeaks, ends with a hung jury on the major counts. He was convicted on contempt and false statement charges.

events.title: Arrest of Lawrence Ray
events.description: Lawrence Ray is arrested at his home in New Jersey and charged with sex trafficking, forced labor, and extortion involving students from Sarah Lawrence College.

events.title: Harvey Weinstein Injured in Jail
events.description: Harvey Weinstein falls and is injured at Rikers Island jail, reporting dizziness and a possible concussion.

events.title: Judge Criticizes Attorney General Barr
events.description: Federal Judge Reggie Walton issues an opinion questioning Attorney General William Barr's credibility and political independence regarding his handling of the Mueller report.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), Manhattan, New York
FCI Fort Dix, Burlington County, New Jersey
Sarah Lawrence College, Westchester County, New York
Southern District of New York courthouses
keyFacts: Prince Andrew formally declined to cooperate with the U.S. investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's co-conspirators, despite a previous public offer.
The captain of the MCC during Epstein's suicide, Jermaine Darden, was scheduled for a transfer and potential promotion, drawing criticism from a defense attorney.
The FBI's investigation into Epstein's network was focusing on Ghislaine Maxwell and others who facilitated the alleged trafficking.
SDNY unsealed a massive indictment in an international horse racing doping conspiracy, alleging widespread abuse and fraud.
U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman publicly asserted the independence of the SDNY from partisan political concerns, amid reported tensions with Attorney General William Barr.
